meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unsteady.
meanings.sent1: Her unsteadiness made it difficult for her to walk in a straight line.
meanings.sent2: The boat rocked back and forth, showing its unsteadiness on the water.
meanings.sent3: The unsteadiness of the table made the cups dance a little jig.
meanings.sent4: His unsteadiness in decision-making was like a ship without a rudder.
meanings.sent5: The unsteadiness of the ladder made climbing it a nerve-wracking experience.

meanings.sent1: The unsteadiness of the makeshift bridge made everyone hesitant to cross.
meanings.sent2: The unsteadiness of the ground beneath their feet caused them to stumble.
meanings.sent3: The unsteadiness of the chair made it a risky choice for the game of musical chairs.
meanings.sent4: The unsteadiness of the old building was a constant source of worry for the residents.
meanings.sent5: The unsteadiness of the foundation led to cracks in the walls of the house.

meanings.definition: The inability to remain steady or balanced.
meanings.sent1: His unsteadiness on the tightrope was evident as he wobbled back and forth.
meanings.sent2: The unsteadiness of his hands made it challenging to hold the delicate glass figurine.
meanings.sent3: The unsteadiness of the dancer's movements added a comical touch to the performance.
meanings.sent4: Her unsteadiness on the bicycle was like a comedy of errors, with frequent stops and starts.
meanings.sent5: The unsteadiness of his voice betrayed his nervousness during the speech.
